DataElement.preferredName: Non-Protocol Targeted Molecular Therapy Agent Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to identify a nonprotocol targeted therapy agent that acts upon specific molecules, metabolic pathways or processes involved in carcinogenesis, tumor growth, or tumor spread. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to the therapeutic application of radiation to treat disease following surgery to remove tumor and associated malignant tissue._Cancer therapies which use drugs to act upon specific molecules, metabolic pathways or processes involved in carcinogenesis, tumor growth, or tumor spread._An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI)_Treatment not specified in a protocol._Cancer therapies designed to act upon specific molecules in metabolic pathways or processes involved in carcinogenesis, tumor growth, or tumor spread.
